greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Decimal expansion of coth(1).
comment: Because the continued fraction for Coth[1] is all positive odd numbers in sequence, the second Mathematica program below also generates the sequence. - _Harvey P. Dale_, Oct 15 2011
By the Lindemann-Weierstrass theorem, this constant is transcendental. - _Charles R Greathouse IV_, May 14 2019
reference: S. Selby, editor, CRC Basic Mathematical Tables, CRC Press, 1970, p. 218.
link: Ivan Panchenko, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..1000
Eric Weisstein's World of Mathematics, Hyperbolic Cotangent.
Eric Weisstein's World of Mathematics, Hyperbolic Functions.
mathematica: RealDigits[Coth[1],10,120][[1]] (* or *) RealDigits[ FromContinuedFraction[ Range[1,1001,2]],10,120][[1]] (* _Harvey P. Dale_, Oct 15 2011 *) (* see Comments, above, for the second program *)
xref: Cf. A005408 (continued fraction: odd numbers), A073821 (continued fraction exp. is even numbers), A073744 (tanh(1)=1/A073747), A073742 (sinh(1)), A073743 (cosh(1)), A073745 (csch(1)), A073746 (sech(1)).
results.author: _Rick L. Shepherd_, Aug 07 2002
